title: With One Tied Hand - The Buffalo Soldiers of World War II
description:
Though veterans of the United States of America liberated others worldwide at immense sacrifice, a little told American story is the unique liberation of the Tuscan people by the Buffalo Soldiers of WWII. After the War ended, these courageous men were sent home to a 'Jim Crow' America. 

Italian history is strikingly different. The impoverished, starving Tuscans feel as if they owe their lives to the Buffalo Soldiers, whom they lovingly dubbed 'Giganti Buoni' (Good Giants). An Italian eyewitness said, “They came down the mountain and freed us, and took care of us.” 

Ivan J. Houston, who was himself wounded in WWII, served in the Segregated 92nd Infantry Division, which bravely fought and pushed the German Nazis and Italian Fascists back behind  The Gothic Line. Tragically, these "Black Warriors" were also forced to fight the U.S. Army’s institutionalized racism, and even individual racist White officers who did not want them to succeed.

“That was just the way the Army was,” says Mr. Houston, retired CEO of America’s third largest African American-owned corporation. 

Between 1945 and 2011, Mr. Houston returned many times to Italy, meeting the Pope, revisiting his battlefields of old, and honoring his fallen comrades at the Florence-American Cemetery. Then, after writing the book, "Black Warriors: The Buffalo Soldiers of WWII, with Gordon Cohn, Mr. Houston was introduced by chance to many, many Italian Reenactors who treated him with warmth and respect. Through the hospitality of a gracious Italian woman, Mattea Piazzesi, a unique bond was formed between two families, the Houston's and the Piazzesi's. Ms Piazzesi had discovered Mr. Houston via his book.

Mr. Houston investigated missing casualty records with the help of local historians, who found the culprit was General Edward Almond, the racist commander (a fact acknowledged by the U.S. War College), who sent an African American Regiment into deadly battle without warning them to expect a heavy Nazi attack. This caused heavy casualties, which Almond then covered up. 

The documentary film, "With One Tied Hand" tells the stirring story of how Tuscan gratitude is finally shown to Mr. Houston, who on behalf of all Buffalo Soldiers is paraded and celebrated on a loving, yearly reenactment of the Liberation of Lucca, the 500-year-old walled city. The film also reveals moving personal stories from surviving eyewitnesses and their families. 

“I think this is the only instance in history where African-Americans have liberated another people,” Mr. Houston concludes.
author_name: Joe and Dayle Hartnett, Director & Producer of With One Tied Hand

title: The Early American Brass Band Podcast
description:
The EABB Podcast focuses on providing information about past and current Early American (19th-century) brass bands through interviews, lectures, and musical recordings. Each episode will have a topic (specific bands, bandleaders, instruments, composers, etc..) or guest (historian, bandleader, active musician) that the participants will talk about. The participants can be any combination of host, co-host, and guest.

The goal of the podcast is to connect and share the early American brass band community in the United States. Current bands will have an opportunity to be highlighted and historical bands will have an opportunity to be taught and kept alive.

title: Sovereign Stories
description: Have you always wanted to understand more about the Native American population, past and present?  This channel will provide weekly videos about American Indian history, politics, and other contemporary issues designed for people of all backgrounds and levels of awareness.  While Sovereign Stories is no replacement for engaging with an Indigenous community or pursuing a degree in American Indian Studies, the channel's goal is to close the gap of understanding between indigenous and non-Indigenous populations.  ----------  Peace is built on a foundation of understanding.  Sovereign Stories provides a free education on American Indian politics and contemporary issues as a 2018 National Peace Academy project.  We hope that, by subscribing to and watching this channel during the next year, our viewers will understand terms like "sovereignty" and "self-determination" and have the tools to critically analyze contemporary issues such as #NoDAPL, Oak Flat, and federal trust responsibility.

title: In den Archiven gefunden
description: Bislang nicht zu Wort gekommene Zeitzeugen, neue Perspektiven, Zahlen und Fakten. Schicksale, Begebenheiten und die immer wiederkehrende Frage – haben wir Menschen aus der Geschichte etwas gelernt? All dies und mehr jeden Dienstag ab 10 Uhr. Der Podcast ist Teil des „Archives, Research and Digitization“ Programm des Pilecki-Instituts Berlin. In Zusammenarbeit mit u.a. dem Bundesarchiv werden unbekannte oder nur schwer verfügbare Dokumente und Quellen erschlossen und digitalisiert. Ziel ist, diese der akademischen Welt zur Verfügung zu stellen, aber auch die aus dem Archivgut gewonnenen Erkenntnisse in die Öffentlichkeit zu tragen. Letzterem Anspruch wollen wir nun u.a. durch unsere neue Podcast-Reihe „In den Archiven gefunden“ gerecht werden.

Come, experience India with us!

Storytrails is an award-winning organisation that attempts to showcase India through her stories. It is a pioneer in designing highly acclaimed, story-based walking tours, audio tours and experiences across India. 
                            
Storytrails is a winner of the 'Creative Entrepreneurship Award' from the British Council, and the 'Travellers’Choice' and 'Hall of Fame' Awards from Tripadvisor among others. It is highly rated in most travel publications and has seen glowing reviews in Lonely Planet, Frommer’s, Conde Nast, and Nat Geo traveller and many more.
                     
Explore more of these stories in our short video series, blog, online workshops, audio tours and walking tours; links on our website www.storytrails.in

title: Museum Het Valkhof - De Podcast
description: Museum Het Valkhof draagt met een indrukwekkende collectie het verhaal van 5.000 jaar geschiedenis uit. Zowel in deze podcast als in het museum willen we laten zien hoe kunst en geschiedenis ons wereldbeeld kleuren. Met de tentoonstelling De Pest (2021) werden de eerste podcasts gemaakt. In dit eerste seizoen nemen diverse experts je mee door de geschiedenis van deze bijzondere infectieziekte. Hoe heeft de pest zijn sporen nagelaten in kunst en cultuur? En wat zijn de paralellen met de coronacrisis? Een jaar later was het tijd voor een nieuwe, relevante, tentoonstelling: Moving Stories: de Rijkdom van de Limes. Met deze tentoonstelling worden de migratieverhalen van  2000 jaar geleden gekoppeld met migratieverhalen van nu. Als voorbereiding op de tentoonstelling spraken de curatoren van de expositie, Marie Stel en Marenne Zandstra met een groep mensen die in de regio woont en een migratieachtergrond heeft: het public-in-residence. Ook sprak het public-in-residence, de mensen met een migratieachtergrond dus, met hedendaagse kunstenaars, die naar aanleiding van die gesprekken nieuw werk maakten voor de tentoonstelling. Een gedeelte van die gesprekken kan je horen in het tweede seizoen van de podcast.

description: Real People, Real Stories, Real History. Brian and Graham dive into some of their favorite historical tales from the Heart of it All.

title: Beringia
description: Mac Ellis and Dawson Zulz are two American students who have lived through a coup, pandemic, several impeachments, two decades of war, and two recessions...all while trying to turn homework in on time. Listen to these two highly caffeinated and mentally exhausted teens discuss everything from politics to Tiktok while connecting to each other from 4,001.5 miles apart.

title: Wär sy mir?
description: Die Burgergemeinde ist in Bern allgegenwärtig und dabei nicht unumstritten. Anhand von Gesprächen mit VertreterInnen gibt dieser Podcast einen Einblick in die Historie, die Struktur und das heutige Wirken der BGB.

title: The Art Story Podcast
description:
Podcasts from The Art Story - The best of art history.

We specialize in explaining artists, movements, and art ideas.  Read much, much more on www.TheArtStory.org

title: Totally Unrelated: History, books & banter among friends
description:
A bunch of Eastern European friends blabbing about history, books, labor issues and such. Occasional venting sessions. 

Episodes drop every other week, on Wednesday.

Shoot us an email at the.totally.unrelated.podcast@gmail.com 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/TUnrelated
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/totally_unrelated_pod/

title: The Session: For the culture , by the culture.
description: “ The Session: For the culture, by the culture “ podcast  is centered around black voices and our experiences as it pertains to mental health. A conversation with black folks from all walks of life and profession , speaking about there experience and views toward personal mental health , the field and etc.
author_name: A'Lyric Miles , M.A. MFT and Kaelyn Pate, LMFT-A

title: Break The System
description: We are the Libertarians for America and this is our podcast about breaking the 2-party system and the issues with today's system.

title: Parks
description:
A podcast on the truth about the creation of U.S. National Parks, retold by Indigenous voices.

Parks is about the Indigenous people who lived, hunted, and created communities on U.S. public lands, living reciprocally with nature for centuries before settler-colonists arrived. It’s about the racism, violence, and lies perpetrated by colonizers and the federal government as they dispossessed land from Native people not long ago.

On this podcast, you'll hear Indigenous perspectives on what’s happening to the land now, and what they hope for tomorrow.

Parks asks you to take a new look at our beloved natural spaces — including their conflicted pasts and their uncertain futures.

title: The Dylan and Joe Basement Podcast
description: Come join us down in the basement! Each week we delve into a new topic about the unexplained, history, paranormal, and overall strangeness and give our thoughts on what it is all about.

title: Christianity in Perspective
description: In this Podcast account, I will be sharing what I know about Christianity. A wide array of topics will be covered most of which will fall under one of three categories: Christian history, Political theology, and Biblical studies

title: The Violet Podcast
description:
Welcome to The Violet, a current affairs podcast for anyone interested in Politics, Economics, History and the Social Sciences. As teachers, we've always been passionate about helping our students understand fundamental theories in the social sciences that explain what's going on in our world. We wanted to open up our classrooms to anyone and everyone who wants to know more about the theory behind the news, presented in a clear, balanced, and insightful manner.
New episodes are uploaded fortnightly on Saturdays.

title: Mud-Spattered Philosophy
description: Classic texts, good conversation, and an attempt to salvage academic thought from too much seriousness.

title: Dear Houston — Love, Asian America
description:
Storytelling is a powerful and beautiful art form that transcends language, space, and time; through this medium of archival practice, we are connected and inspired by stories passed on through generations. In this podcast, we will be sharing stories from the Asian American community in Houston, where stories collected by oral history interviews at the Houston Asian American Archive (HAAA), are weaved, told, and retold, via a myriad of topics that relate to their intersections with the Asian American identity. HAAA is managed by Rice University's Chao Center for Asian Studies, and located at the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library. It collects, documents, and preserves the lived experiences of the Asian diaspora in Houston, aiming to develop a broader understanding of history through their lens, which continues to evolve towards the studies of Asia from a transnational perspective.

The series is produced by Ann Shi, Associate Curator, with guidance provided by Dr. Anne Chao, Program Manager and Co-Founder of Houston Asian American Archive, adjunct faculty of School of Humanities, Rice University. Special thanks to Lisa Balabanlilar, Director of Chao Center for Asian Studies, without whose support this series would not have been possible; and thanks to Haejin Koh and Hae Hun Matos for their meticulous organization. Funding is provided by the Houston Asian American Archive and Liu Distinguished Visitor Series, of the Chao Center for Asian Studies, Rice University; with additional support from Dr. Anne Chao, who generously provided her research funding.

title: Joy and Conversation
description:
Joy and Conversation is a podcast about Jewish history and culture. It is propelled by curiosity and a passion for teaching and learning. Eclectic but accessible, it is like looking into a kaleidoscope and seeing the vibrant colors, complex shapes, and rich dimensions of Jewish life and identity--but for your ears. It illuminates Jewish diversity by focusing on under-told stories. It emphasizes vitality and dynamism by showcasing humanity and creativity. Centered on asking questions and dedicated to sharing knowledge, Joy and Conversation breaks silences, crosses borders, cultivates understanding, and encourages compassion. Finding joy in conversation is a mitzvah. 
To learn more, visit joyandconversationpodcast.com or Twitter @JandCpodcast.

title: Brain Wool
description:
Lectures of craft and empirical apprehensions from a self-proclaimed cave prophet/fragmentary girl/digital archaeologist/tea enthusiast.

Overlooked nooks of history, the uncharted territories of the art world, and simply mundane experiences I find delightful to talk about!

title: Affluenza
description: punch ups & take downs

title: Maladjusted Podcast
description:
America is in the throes of a national racial reckoning. In an era where people across the country have paused to examine the role that their systems play in perpetuating racism, Southern Methodist University is not exempt. 

Shara Jeyarajah, an SMU Human Rights Fellow, explores the history of Southern Methodist University through a racial justice lens. From President R. Gerald Turner to students across Greek councils, Shara interviews SMU community members across races and generations to reflect on all that has changed since the era of desegregation-- and all that hasn't. Maladjusted doesn't shy away from the difficult conversations. For instance, what does the name of our university have to do with slavery? Why isn't Greek life as diverse as the rest of campus? What's the difference between the experiences of Black students in the 1960s versus the 2020s? Does SMU have a place in a truly antiracist society? Together, let's tell the truth about our history.

title: Hail to The Pod
description: A podcast where two high school students discuss American and international events, policies, and issues. Fellow students and other guests on both sides of the political spectrum will be invited to spice up discussions and debates.

title: In The Shadows: The Hidden Figures Of History
description: We aim to tell the stories of history’s hidden figures and evaluate their importance. We think it’s necessary to shed a light on the role of women throughout history whether that be in revolutions, scientific developments or government. They played an instrumental part in shaping the world we live in, but so often their stories go untold.

title: Royally Screwed
description: A bi-weekly show exploring the greatest, worst, and craziest rulers throughout human history. How did a man trick his way into becoming a Russian Czar? Did Caligula actually wage war against the ocean? Was Alexander really that Great? Get your answers and learn about some lesser known rulers who you might learn to love or love to hate.

title: 4Score
description: 4 Score and 2 semesters ago, our founding conspiracists by the names of DJ, Ish, Max, and David started a podcast. 4Score covers the mysteries of the world and debate if they exist, or are illusions.

title: Armchair History
description: Bite-sized pieces of history to give you a better understanding of various historical events, done by someone who loves to share history's most interesting stories.

title: Arch Street Meeting House: Untold Stories in Quaker History
description:
Quakers have and continually help shape the definition of freedom by actively standing at the forefront of major reform movements in American history, including abolition, African-American history, women's rights, prison reform, making education and healthcare available to all, and temperance.

Join Denis Long each month as he interviews educators and historians on how Quakers have made long-lasting impacts on history. Each episode explores the untold stories of Quakers, shedding new light on the Quaker history narrative.
author_name: Arch Street Meeting House Preservation Trust

title: First Impressionists
description: We talk about all things art- our favorite artists, what art is, what art we don’t like, art literacy and so much more!

title: The GOTUS
description:
Most of the Presidents Of The United States are entirely undeserving of their legacies. On this show, we'll pick out one American each episode who truly served everyone in the union - who truly deserves to be remembered. These are the Greatest Of The United States.

New episodes released the first Thursday of every month!

title: It's a Scary Life
description:
Join your host Melodi as she tells co-host Ellen and listeners a tale about the grisly, shocking, and gloomy parts of life. Every other week Melodi will tell a story from true crime, history, or on the macabre things that fuel humanities fears to her dear friend Ellen who knows little to nothing on the topic. To bring our listeners the best experience, Melodi does a deep dive into research on a topic and feeds Ellen to help her brace for the information she will hear for the first time.

https://www.patreon.com/itsascarylife

title: The Snowman Podcast
description: A Podcast discussing the greatness of America!  Past, Present and Future.

title: Dialogues in Afrolatinidad
description:
The podcast adaptation of the highly successful Dialogues in Afro-Latinidad webinar series ran by the University of Pittsburgh's Afro-Latinx studies initiative is here! In each episode, we educate, amplify, and elevate the stories, histories, and cultures of Afro-Latin American and Afro-Latinx communities, and their transnational connections. Within 30 minutes, listeners can learn more about the migrations, comparative histories, social and political struggles, and creativity that encompasses Afrolatinidad. 
All hosted by Dr. Michele Reid-Vazquez who will be joined by a variety of scholars, writers, educators, and artist guest speakers each episode.

title: Haunted Hermanas Podcast
description: Join three sisters bi-weekly as they discuss paranormal activities and haunts!

title: Art of War
The Golden Mic Experience
description:
The residents of The Village at Northridge get REAL and open up on their most intimate memories, share priceless words of wisdom and reveal secrets to love & living in a unique interview, that’s more than just a podcast, it’s an experience! 
From dating at 79 to stories of Holocaust survival, audiences will hear incredible tales of triumph through the prism of an elder with our 82 year old host, Bill Moran. 
Breaking senior citizen stereotypes, offering a space for family historians and sparking generational conversations...Welcome to the Golden Mic Experience, where age isn’t just a number, it's everything.

title: Code of Support Presents: Profiles In Service
description:
Code of Support Foundation brings you authentic stories, experiences and insights of American heroes, within and around the military community, through interviews by Co-founder and Chairman Emeritus MG Alan B. Salisbury, USA (Ret.). 

"Code of Support Presents: Profiles In Service" chats with guests who reflect the full spectrum of fascinating men and women, veterans and civilians, CEO's and staffers, generals and sergeants, who have made a difference, and are having a real impact in today's world.

Learn more about the Code of Support Foundation, and the great work we do assisting service members, veterans, caregivers and military family members, at www.codeofsupport.org

Music Disclaimer: Music promoted by https://www.free-stock-music.com
Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0)
https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

title: History's Great Tales
description: This is a weekly podcast about History, books and news by me, your host, Owen!

title: Pirates Without A Ship
description: "Pirates Without A Ship" is a mystery podcast where two pirates and a lizard tell each other interesting, spooky and mysterious mysteries/conspiracies/historical events.

title: EL DILETANTE
description: Conciliábulo de diletantes con Jacobo Bergareche como simposiarca, Lisandro Silva Echevarría “El Licha” como trovador residente, Diego Echévarri de productor, y varios invitados que juran no volver.

title: The American Idea
description: The American Idea explores America's Founding principles and their effect on American history and government. Through thoughtful conversations with renowned academics and public figures from across the country, we examine the history and political thought behind our country’s greatest documents and debates, as well as contemporary issues, American popular culture, and political statesmanship. The podcast is a production of the Ashbrook Center and hosted by Jeff Sikkenga.

title: Sandfast - en podkast om okkuperte Vest-Sahara
description: Like ved Kanariøyene, på Afrikas fastland, lar Europa sine egne, kortsiktige interesser gå foran prinsipper om menneskerettigheter og fred. Velkommen til Sandfast - vår podkast om Vest-Sahara, den siste kolonien på det afrikanske kontinent.

title: The Unknown Soldiers Podcast
description: The Forgotten Wars, Battles, and Perspectives of Military History

title: El Lado Salvaje
description: Acompañanos mientras nos adentramos en temas interesantes y salvajes del reino animal, relatando historias fascinantes sobre animales extraordinarios y únicos que dejaron su huella a través de los años. Y aprenderemos datos curiosos sobre las mas sorprendentes especies extintas o en peligro de extinción.

title: Smoke & Shadow
description:
Grab your bowls, blunts, or bongs and join host Victoria Sadowski as she dives into topics from the history of ancient religions to the evolution of mythological tales that circulate throughout the occult world.

New episodes every 1st and 3rd Monday of every month.

title: Perfectos Pecadores
description:
Somos 3 perfectos pecadores tratando de entender nuestra iglesia catolica, luchando dia a dia, en el mundo real para seguir a Cristo. Sin ser expertos, nuestras conversaciones seran sencillas y aprenderemos juntos cosas importantes de nuestra fe. Acompañanos y aprendamos juntos. 

"Porque sabemos que la ley es espiritual, pero yo soy carnal, vendido a la esclavitud del pecado." Romanos 7, 14

title: Ilan Shchori - My tel-Aviv - History of Tel Aviv
description:
שיחות, ראיונות ותוכניות עם אילן שחורי בתחנות וערוצי הרדיו השונים בנושאי תולדות תל אביב
Talks, interviews and programs with Ilan Shchori on various radio stations and channels on the history of Tel Aviv

title: Dead Current by History in Politics
description: Durham University's History in Politics Society discuss historical and political events and issues, with leading academics and students. We also explore the important relationship between history and politics.

title: Social Club
description: I learn about interesting people and share ideas you can use in your life.

title: Los Idus
description: Podcast de divulgación en clave de humor grabado en A Kalimera Estudios y presentado por Iago Miguez y Juan Arias. Ciencia, Arte, Historia, Política, Mundos Digitales, Entrevistas, Música, y Radio Experimental. Emitimos en riguroso diferido desde Santiago de Compostela a los confines del universo conocido. Síguenos en Spotify, Instagram, Twitter, e incluso por la calle.

title: Liberty Under Law
description: A podcast of the Robert H. Jackson Center that explores contemporary issues of equality, fairness, and justice with a Jacksonian lens through in-depth conversations with experts, academics, innovators, and those doing the boots-on-the-ground work. Liberty under Law also addresses important historic events in the life and legacy of Robert H. Jackson, U.S. Supreme Court Justice and Chief U.S. Prosecutor at Nuremberg. Hosted by Kristan McMahon, Jackson Center President.

title: Coffee, Chaos, & Chatter
description:
This is a podcast where random chats happen. Sarah and Sabrina have been friends since middle school so you know the conversations will be entertaining and a little chaotic! Listen in as we explore this crazy thing called life!
Over the year, we have delved into the realm of witchcraft, ghost stories, mystery history, and tons of macabre murder stories. We plan to continue some of these conversations, plus a lot more just talking about life.
#CoffeeChaosChatter

title: Latitude Podcast
description: Latitude is a podcast about the built enviroment that investigates architecture, design, and visual arts, and how these relate to issues of territory, citizenship, and ecosystems.

title: Miltalkee
description:
A podcast that sometimes touches on important topics; but often doesn't

Join BrewCity Benjamin from Milwaukee, Wisconsin, and his eclectic rotating panel of guests while they have bar conversations about 3 "relevant" topics per episode. 

Whether it's Boomers vs Millennials, "What is Milwaukee's brand?", the Eastern Front in WW2, or which fictional characters you want to have your back in a zombie apocalypse, join your virtual buddies in some fun jib-jab.

title: IB History
description: This podcast will cover interwar Spain, Germany and Italy, Civil Rights and Russia.

title: Mortals
description:
From embalming and epitaphs, to mourning and morgues, each episode we explore how humans have dealt with death throughout history.

Mortals is created, hosted, and edited by three morbidly curious individuals: Christeah, Mariah, and Jeannine.

title: The Why
description:
Venezuela has suffered and economic crisis for more than a decade, which has resulted in millions of Venezuelans seeking a better future. Emigration takes courage, but it's not easy. Tune in to The Why, where we were able to have conversations that we were never able to have. 
Representing Venezuelans around the world🇻🇪

🎙Hosted and created by Giulia Savarino.

title: The Cobblestone Podcast
description:
The Cobblestone Podcast is a series of conversations with prominent figures from the rich musical community, based in the Cobblestone pub at the top of Smithfield square, Dublin.

Created by Tom Mulligan in 1988, the Cobblestone has played host to Traditional music sessions daily, for the last 30 years. Be it a session up the front or a concert in the Back Room venue, there is an inevitability of bumping into top-class musicians with a passion for their art. the Cobblestone has no TVs or pool tables and people are encouraged to sit back with a pint, have a conversation, or listen to some great music. 

Join hosts, Ispini na hEireann, who interview a plethora of Musicians and Characters that have made their way through the doors of the cobblestone at one time or another. We hope you enjoy this podcast and it brings you just a small bit closer to the comfort Cobblestone through the medium of conversation.

With thanks to Tom Mulligan for giving us this opportunity and Neillidh Mulligan for allowing us the use of his tune, Barr Na Cuille, as our theme. Thanks To Stephen McCann For his tireless work on sound.

find us @ http://cobblestonepub.ie/
                 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ispini_na_heireann/
get in touch @ sausagesofireland@gmail.com

Hosts: Adam Holohan & Tomas Mulligan (Ispini Na hErieann)
Sound: Stephen McCann

title: Truth Matters
description: The ‘Truth Matters’ podcast is an in-depth exploration into the true nature of our reality. With sourced and cited materials and expert interviews, this podcast exposes the ancient & powerful, secretive organizations that are steering the world in one direction. In the age of information we must be able to discern what is truth and what is error. Now more than ever, truth matters.

title: Night of the Living History
description: Join your host, Britney and co-host Annie in exploring spooky history!  This podcast is dedicated to real history stories that contain macabre and dark themes and sometimes witches, vampires, and monsters.

title: Cafecito con Conciencia
description: Cafecito con Conciencia is a space for folks to engage in critical platicas (talks) regarding social issues happening in our communities. It is a shared space where we engage in critical dialogues regarding social injustices, community building, unity, and more.

title: NSF Talks
description: NSF Talks is a brand new series to dive deeper than ever before into the complexity of Norwegian Spitfire Foundation, our mission, and the various of people that are involved in helping us achieve our goals.

title: Are You A Fan?
description:
Welcome to "Are You a Fan?" the podcast that takes you on an immersive journey into the fascinating world of beloved fictional figures. Join us as we dive deep into the lives, histories, and impact of iconic characters that have captured our hearts and imaginations.

In each episode, we unravel the captivating stories behind these characters, exploring their origins, the masterminds who brought them to life, and the profound impact they have had on the entertainment industry. We delve into their journeys from conception to becoming cultural phenomena, uncovering the secrets and insights that make them truly extraordinary.

But our exploration doesn't stop there. We step into the character's universe, unraveling their identities, motivations, and the remarkable adventures that define them. From their appearances in TV shows, movies, and games to their enduring presence in various forms of media, we examine their evolution and celebrate the diverse interpretations that have shaped their legacy.

And here's the twist: we're not just sharing facts and analysis. We invite you to join us in the conversation. Are you a fan of these characters, or do you have reservations? Together, we explore our personal connections, engage in lively discussions, and reflect on the character's impact on our own lives and popular culture.

"Are You a Fan? Exploring Iconic Characters" is the ultimate podcast for fans, enthusiasts, and anyone curious about the enduring allure of beloved characters. Whether you're a long-time devotee or just discovering these legends for the first time, we welcome you to join us on this thrilling exploration of character-driven storytelling.

So, are you ready to dive into the worlds of our favorite fictional figures? Tune in to "Are You a Fan?" and join us on this captivating journey of discovery.

title: Weiß-Rot-Weiß. Freiheit im Wandel
description:
Weiß-Rot-Weiß. Freiheit im Wandel. Der neue Podcast aus Berlin zu Belarus von Karoline Gil und Patryk Szostak. 

In wenigen Wochen wird die Eröffnung der neuen Ausstellung des Pilecki-Instituts Berlin über die Proteste und aktuelle Lage in Belarus stattfinden. Begleitend dazu, erscheint zunächst eine neue Podcast-Reihe.

Angesichts der nicht erst seit den gefälschten Präsidentschaftswahlen am 9.August regelmäßig stattfindenden Massenproteste gegen Alexander Lukashenkas Regime, wäre man eigentlich geneigt zu sagen „Im Osten viel Neues“, um einen Klassiker zu paraphrasieren. Die Menschen gehen auf die Straßen, weil sie der Korruption, Staatswillkür und der fehlenden Meinungsfreiheit eine Absage erteilen. Seit Beginn der Proteste wurden bereits über 40.000 Menschen verhaftet, gefoltert oder anderweitig misshandelt und erniedrigt. Sie sehen sich mit einer Mischung aus Repressalien und Ermüdung konfrontiert, denen der Westen nur Halbherziges entgegenzusetzen weiß.

Anders als letztes Jahr war davon in den letzten Monaten leider nicht mehr viel in den Medien zu spüren – eine Art Grundskepsis hat sich breit gemacht, bedingt durch fehlende Aussichten auf schnellen Erfolg, die Annahme, dass man ob der geopolitischen Verhältnisse ohnehin nur über begrenzte Handlungsoptionen verfügt oder dass es sich bei Belarus ohnehin nur um ein mäßig bedeutsames, weil weit entfernt liegendes Land handelt.
 
Karoline Gil und Patryk Szostak wollen sich damit nicht abfinden und hinterfragen diese Annahmen, indem sie  Expert:innen, Belarus:innen, internationale Beobachter:innen und Politiker:innen zu Wort lassen. Dass es dabei teils auch zu unterschiedlichen Einschätzungen kommt, liegt in der Natur der Sache, aber in einem herrscht Einigkeit: Es wäre ein Trugschluss zu glauben, dass die Marginalisierung des Themas in der Öffentlichkeit realen außenpolitischen Gegebenheiten und Verhältnissen entspricht. Ganz im Gegenteil. 

Davon war auch der erste Gast bei „Weiß-Rot-Weiß“, der Journalist und Publizist Richard Herzinger überzeugt, welcher in einem seiner Artikel folgendes konstatierte: „Belarus, das sind wir“. Zusammen mit ihm wollten wir zunächst der fundamentalen Frage „Warum?“ auf den Grund gehen:

Warum ist Belarus für den Westen wichtig?

title: Sex and the Sacred
description: Welcome to Sex and the Sacred, where religion, history, and sexuality collide!  SatS is a bi-weekly podcast that explores the history of world religions, with a focus on moments of interest in women's, gender, and sexuality studies.  Each episode explores a different topic, with show notes posted on the website.

title: Last Call with Richard Crouse
description:
Last Call is a podcast on the stories behind the places where everybody knows your name. It's a chance to soak up the ambiance of the world's greatest watering holes without leaving your home.

I’m Richard Crouse. I tended bar for seventeen years everywhere from hot spots to dive bars and I thought I had seen it all.

In my life behind bars I witnessed everything from first dates and marriage proposals to knife fights and a woman who brought a pet monkey in for a drink.

Nothing could surprise me.

Or so I thought.

Then I heard about how a lion who visited Harry’s New York Bar in Paris inspired Ernest Hemingway to write one of his greatest novels. And why there are century old chicken bones hanging above the beer-stained bar at McSorleys in New York City. And how Vincent Sardi refused to do business with the mob during Prohibition, so his famous Broadway Restaurant didn’t serve alcohol until the 21st amendment passed, six year after they first opened.

With the help of the Last Call radio players, music and interviews with cocktail detectives Jared Brown and Anistatia Miller, The Indiana Jones of Tiki, Jeff “Beachbum” Berry and Two and Two: McSorley's, My Dad, and Me author Rafe Bartholomew, I bring these stories, and many more, to life in my podcast Last Call. It’s fact folded in with a sprinkling of fiction, because, well, who doesn’t exaggerate after a few drinks?

So, open that bottle of wine or crack that beer and join me for an intoxicating guided tour of some of the strange stories from some of the world’s best boozers.

title: De Maassluise Podcast
description: De Maassluise Podcast, de podcast waarin vader en zoon op zoek gaan naar al het bijzonders in en uit Maassluis. We gaan in gesprek met Sluizers, vertellen korte verhalen en behandelen de geschiedenis en toekomst van Maassluis.

title: 5 Minutes of Your Time?
description: In “5 Minutes of Your Time?,” Brother Jones, a Ph.D. student in Africana Studies, discusses racism and the relevance of history on the modern Black American experience socially, politically, and economically, all within five minutes, give or take a few.

title: Tomfoolery with MJ + Gabe
description: Do you like X-Men 2? That's ok if you don't. These two friends talk about too many different things. Come kick it with us

title: How The Fuck Did We Get Here?
description: This podcast takes a deep dive into the backstory of any number of cultural phenomena that shock, appall or captivate modern audiences. On each episode you can expect the hosts, Mason, Nader and Chuck to ask the question "how the fuck did we get here?" of topics like Trap Metal, Drill Rap, or Pop Punk Revival music. Join us, as we strap into our rickety time machine and try to explain things that we only learned about a week in advance!

title: Cuentos En la Virgocueva
description:
Cuentos en la virgocueva un podcast de Humor en los que vamos a hablar de casos paranormales, crímenes, ufología  o todo lo que consideremos digno de ser contado en la virgocueva. 
Pónganse cómodos y sean bienvenidos a la virgocueva!

title: Love, Truth and Power Podcast
description: Love, Truth & Power where we explore the experiences of everyday people of color, in a vulnerable but unapologetic way, empowered by the truth of our experiences, the love of our family and friends, but without the pomp and circumstance of politics, production, or scripts.  The hope is that this will be a place where stories build belonging, leave you feeling empowered, and encourage you to exercise your power to identify our shared humanity.  Together we can increase our circle of friends, community, and the company we keep.  Let’s get into it.

title: The Zapatistas Podcast - Lessons and Stories from Chiapas
description: 'The Zapatistas Podcast - Lessons and Stories from Chiapas' is an educational and culturally immersive audio series that delves into the Zapatista movement from the early days of the uprising until the present day with news of their much anticipated European tour in the Summer of 2021. Over this podcast series by the Galway Feminist Collective and Promedios Mexico, you'll learn about who the Zapatistas are, their history of struggles and the lessons that we can learn from them, as well as songs and stories from within the movement, bringing each episode to life. The release of this podcast coincides with the Zapatistas' first visit to Europe and aims at giving folks in Ireland (and elsewhere) an insight into the Zapatistas through interviews with some of those who have worked closely with the movement on topics such as community media, womxn's organising, agriculture, education and autonomy, retracing some of the steps that their struggle has taken on its long and steady road to autonomy. Throughout this series, we will highlight their learnings, and obstacles, but above all their creativity and determination to make other worlds a reality.
author_name: the Galway Feminist Collective and Promedios Mexico

title: True Crimes Untold Podcast
description: Hi. I’m Jess. Join me every other Sunday as I discuss the terrifying details of the most heinous crimes ever committed. If you like learning about disturbing and twisted true crime stories, then check out this podcast.

title: Historias de la Biblia que jamas creerás que hubieran pasado.
description:
Escucharas situaciones verdaderas que pasaron hace ya muchos años, historias que están llenas de emociones, intrigas, engaños, peleas y hasta violaciones!
Conceremos a un rey que por miedo a que lo mataran se hace pasar por loco, y tambien conoceremos a una Reyna que por su maldad, es arrojada desde una torre y es comida por los perros, y muchísimas historias mas, todas basadas en la vida real, las cuales dejaran grandes enseñanzas para las futuras generaciones.

Espero las disfrutes.

title: Life In Martial Arts and Stories of History of the World with Alexis Mayren
description: This podcast is not just about Martial Arts or MMA but also talks about History and stories of the world and it well also talk about the life in Martial Arts and life out of it and it will cover life, fighters, fight events, plus the books out there why history is so important. It will also have guests and other people besides Alexis Mayren the host but we will bring the best out of lots of all topics including stories of War, Crime and suspense in everything.

title: Guess Who's Coming To Kansas City with MC Richardson
description: Explore Social Issues with MC Richardson and Guests

title: Yazın Durağı
description: Edebiyattan tarihe, politikadan bilime kadar birçok alanda bilgilerin, fikirlerin, düşüncelerin paylaşıldığı ve bir amatör tarafından yapılan podcast serisi. Bence güzele benziyor, sence?

title: Whispers in The Trees
description:
Whispers in the trees is a dark podcast focusing on the great white North. Surrounding all of the grisly truths from the kindest place on earth, to the head scratching unknowns hidden beneath the snow. This isn’t just eh-nother dark podcast, these are the whispers in the trees. 

Please consider helping me out on Buy Me A Coffee to support this show and allow me to continue this passion. https://www.buymeacoffee.com/whisperspodcast

title: Sons of Antiquity Podcast
description: If you've ever wanted to learn about modern topics from a historical perspective (or vise versa), this is the show for you! From religion, to rap music, to weightlifting, to ancient thought experiments, biographies and book reviews, we cover it all! Subscribe to the channel and follow us on social media for an endless supply of ancient wisdom, and the occasional meme.

title: Crazy, Hexy, Ghoul
description: A podcast about the peculiar, the curious to the bizarre. So come and join us as we obsess over ghosties and sh*t.

title: Esta es otra historia
description:
Anécdotas históricas tan bizarras y peculiares que todos los libros de historia serios las han evitado por parecer ficción. En este programa las rescatamos y las contamos.
©2020 MQN501 (P)2020 MQN501

title: The Push Podcast
description: A podcast that uses various Bible stories to touch base on religious struggles and how to overcome them.

title: Double Deal - True Stories of Criminals, Crimes and Lies
description: My name is Lara Chicofsky, and my cohost is Nina Jobe. We created this podcast to shine a light on some of the lesser known characters and crimes in Boston and New England. We've spent the past two years researching the Boston crime scene primarily focusing on the 1960s. There are many podcasts and books available about organized crime in the Boston area, but ours is a bit different. I spent most of my life in my father’s world. Eavesdropping when I was a kid, listening intently when he was at the end of his life. I often took what he said with a grain of salt. He was, after all, a conman, an expert liar and an Academy Award worthy actor, but there was always a sliver of truth in his stories.

title: Mala Diplomática
description: Podcast do Instituto Diplomático do Ministério dos Negócios Estrangeiros

title: Canned Theory
description:
Conspiracy theories, the occult, supernatural, aliens...and beyond. Welcome Theorists!! Join us as we explore some of the strangest conspiracies and absurd phenomenon.

Listen to new episodes every Friday on Spotify,, Apple Podcast and wherever you stream your podcasts. Follow us on Twitter and Instagram: @cannedtheory

Check out our YouTube Channel for new content. Don't forget to like and subscribe. Patreon coming soon!

title: Aspects of History
description: History Editor Ollie Webb-Carter interviews historians and authors on the past - from the ancient world right up to the modern day. In each episode, Ollie seeks to get to the bottom of a story or scrutinise a figure from history, but in a light-hearted way. There are bonus episodes too, on current events and anniversaries to the Aspects of History Film Club.

title: In Them Thar Hills: Discovering Gold in the People, Places, and Events of Lumpkin County
description: Join host Jason Lemley as he highlights the gold found in the people, places and events of Lumpkin County with a particular focus on what makes the Dahlonega / Lumpkin County community rich!

title: China On The Rocks
description: Our podcast is about the F&B industry in China, over drinks we talk about booze, cocktail history, and our stories related to our experiences working here!

title: إيه الحكاية؟
description: برنامج سياسي تحليلي، يسلط الضوء على أهم القضايا في مصر ويناقشها من زاوية تحليلية، يأتيكم كل إثنين وجمعة الساعة 8 مساءا بتوقيت القاهرة

title: Universidad Autónoma de Santa Ana - UNASA
description: Podcasts de la Universidad Autónoma de Santa Ana, UNASA. Santa Ana, El Salvador, C.A.

title: Folklore Of Cumbria 'Kast
description:
In a sparse county, all the ghosts, ghoulies, myths, and legends can lie dormant for a long time.
So I'm gonna wake some of 'em up.

Throughout this 'Kast, there will be a lot of the lore that's fit to sing as well as some stories straight from the pony's face - and as an added bonus, anything said pony has witnessed first hand.
So hop up on this amateur and trot through tales old and new from County Cumbria.

title: American Cycle
description: This is American Cycle, a podcast featuring Larry Beckett’s live performances of his poetry. Beckett’s poems have been collected in the book American Cycle, which Jonah Raskin says “takes readers into the past and rewrites our national epic for the twenty-first century.” Inspired by our folklore and past, American Cycle is available now from Running Wild Press.

title: Family Histories: Our Stories, Our Roots
description: What better place to develop an appreciation for the ordinary lives that make history than in our own backyards? In this podcast series, Paulo Freire-University's 8th grade students interview family members (and extended family members!) to discover the small moments, choices, and happy accidents that shaped their lives.

title: The Antebellum Diaspora Project
description: I am descended from American-born enslaved people from North and South Carolina. Many of my ancestors were among the 2.5 million people of African descent who were forcibly migrated and permanently separated from their families. The Antebellum Diaspora Project is a descendent reunification project with a focus on reconnecting families, amplifying the humanity of people who were enslaved during the antebellum era, and sharing negated American history through the perspectives of the people who were most deeply affected by forced migration during the antebellum era in the US.

title: Real Chicago
description: Real Chicago stories from real Chicagoans

title: Manipulating The Masses
description: Kaitlin McMillan and Zach Phillips, Owners of McMillan & Phillips Digital Creative Agency, use their experience in the advertising world to look through history at some of the most influential, problematic, and hysterical ways people have come under the mass influence by rulers, companies, political movements, and leaders of all types.

title: The Burros of Berea Podcast
description: The Burros of Berea is a conversational podcast. We study the Bible and we talk about it. Not all of us are of the same faith and one of us doesn't actually have one. That's wonder-full! We all love one another and are going to continue to talk about these things. The things we believe in and what we believe about what we read in the Bible. Not all of these things are true, some of them are opinion and speculation. Thank you for listening and speculating with us!

title: Podvant Garde
description:
Two art history majors and a comedian walk into a recording studio...
No, really. Podvant Garde is an art history podcast that delves into the often untold facets of an artists' life. Join Andrea Guzzetta, Katrina Davis and Jordan Leigh Williams as they discover more about the artists they love and themselves, with a decent amount of laughs along the way.
author_name: Andrea Guzzetta, Katrina Davis, Jordan Leigh Williams

title: Stuttering in Silence
description:
Gavin and Matt dive into the world of podcasting with various topics including sports, conspiracy theories, movies, tv shows, comic books, and much more! We hope to bring you a mixture of detailed accounts and comedic opinions on a variety of topics. 
New uploads EVERY Thursday!

title: Please Expand
description:
Please Expand is a podcast where I discuss non-fiction books with their authors. But Please Expand is not just about summaries; it's about conversations. I go into every episode having read each book in great detail and having reflected on the fundamental assumptions, foundations and questions with which the book grapples.
If you, like me, have finished a book with burning questions that only the author could answer, then Please Expand is the podcast for you.
Pick up one of the books I'm discussing and settle in for what I hope will be an illuminating conversation.

title: Nature's Tales
description: Flora, fauna, and fungi folklore! Stories, anecdotes, poetry, and folk tales from around the world focusing on nature. From Greek mythology of woodland flowers to fairy doorways in a Hawthorn tree, this podcast will enhance your relationship with the natural world and make you think differently about the magic that surrounds you.

title: أهو ده إللي صار
description: سلسلة بودكاست تاريخي ثقافي

title: Mule Tracks:  UCM After 150 Years
description:
From its roots as a progressive teacher’s college founded after the Civil War to an internationally recognized university, the University of Central Missouri continually recreates itself through the very students who pass through its halls of education.
Join KMOS as we explore the journey of the university from its founding in 1871 through the tragedies of war, and the triumphs of peace with the unwavering mission of education for service.

title: Talking Downey with Mario and Eric.
Conversations at Midnight
description: Conversations at Midnight is a podcast focused on the discovery of the “more” in life; that through deep conversation and determined investigating,  I might, with humility and passion, help illuminate the more obscure, darker and mysterious aspects of this ancient planet we call Earth. This podcast is designed to pay homage and respect to what I believe to be serious topics. From the missing 411, to cryptozoology, aliens and the paranormal, my goal is to provide listeners information without jest or mockery, so that I may not mistakenly make light of a subject many are already too embarrassed or afraid to talk about. I strive to remain family friendly; there will be no profanities or inappropriate conversations. That being said, I advice viewers to still remain  cautious when listening, as these subject matters might prove too much for some audiences to handle, or too frightening for any younger listeners. Thank you so much for tuning in, and I hope my voice will help bring comfort to your hearts.

title: Wronged Sports on College Sports History
description: Welcome to the podcast, thank you so much for finding us and listening to us. To tell you a little about Wronged Sports; we cover college sports but mostly college football history. Topics covered will be college football programs no longer playing, college football losing streak, worst teams, best teams, and so much more.

title: Paranormal Minds
description: Everyone takes life too seriously - and the world of the paranormal is no different! Join us in our light hearted take on the unexplained.

title: The Celtic History Podcast
description:
A narrative history podcast which will attempt a coherent narrative from the origins of the Celtic people's all the way up to the revival of Celtic languages in the modern era. 

Image from cover Provided by The British Museum
https://www.britishmuseum.org/collection/object/H_1951-0402-2

Music Provided for intro/outro "Beyond the Warriors" by Guifrog
https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Guifrog

title: Kvinnohistoria med Ida och Harriet
description: Vi tycker det är intressant med kvinnor och historia. Eftersom vi är musiker har vi skrivit några låtar om sånt som vi har blivit nyfikna på och fantiserat runt. Välkomna!

title: Ингрия без границ
description:
Ингрия без границ - теле- и радиовещание из Нарвы, в 17 веке - столицы Ингерманландии (Ингрии).
В этом подкасте мы будем говорить о проблемах приграничных территорий, что сближает, и что разделяет их жителей. Прежде всего, на примере того, что происходит в Ингерманландии (восточной части Эстонии и соседней Ленинградской области).

title: JustCuzTV
description: JustCuzTV hosted by Toney Dark & Mark is a series featuring two cousins discussing & debating things that most people don't.  It's hilarious and informative, we promise

title: Crónicas Cabronas
description: El podcast donde un invitado y dos cabrones cuentan las crónicas de un cabrón, cabrona, cabrone histórico que todos o nadie conoce
author_name: Francisco C. Illan y Jhony A. Romero

title: Black & Opinionated
description: Are you passionate or interested in history, including Black history? Come listen to the podcast as I talk about stories of events, men and women that have made and left an impact on the world.

title: The Bad Blonde | Car History Nerd
description: This is recorded from the live automotive radio show in Corpus Christi, Texas on 1440KEYS. Ever wanted to know more about the mavericks of the automotive world? The cars that changed the world and the men behind them? This is my cup of tea, listen and enjoy the wild tales of the auto industry!

title: It's In The Soup!
description: A podcast where we talk about our niche interests!

title: Para Bellum
description: A podcast of sermons, discussions, teachings within the reformed camp of Christianity.

description: Digitized audio cassettes from CGA journal

title: White Response Project
description: The more you know the history, the more your perspective changes.

title: Love, Asians
description: Love, Asians is a student-led podcast aimed to raise awareness as well as discussing more about the ongoing Asian sterotypes and news around the world. Over the past recent years, us Asians have been the victims to a lot of racial and social abuse that mostly come from COVID-19. We not only felt the need to share our stories out but also to bring attention to other stories by Asian as well.  Along with our anchors Tracy, Zara and Phylisse, we hope to inspire our listeners around the world on the issues that concerns us Asians today. Love, Asians

title: Fórmula del Misterio

Weirdcore History and more!
With Tyler Cole and Andy Bosch.
Join us as we discuss various topics (beautiful and not)

title: תיקים באפלה - אריאל ונתנאל סמריק -

title: The Leon Lounge

title: A History of Trinity Radicalism
description: Listen along as I have discussions with Trinity professors Cheryl Greenberg and Paul Lauter as well as former Trinity students, Ananya Rav and Russell Fugett to identify and examine Trinity's history with activism.

title: Con Men Podcast
description: The Con Men Podcast is a disputed history podcast. Each week, we have a round table discussion about the 'underbelly' of history that is not often discussed.

title: Cars and Comrades
description:
Fusion of car culture and leftist politics.
Doing our part to make car culture more inclusive and approachable.
Racing on the road to revolution.

title: Women Writing ...
description: A new feminist podcast about literature.

title: Coal and Salt
description:
Welcome to Coal and Salt! This is going to be as personal as it gets in terms of everything that I do. But again, who am I? Hi I am Farhid! And these are going to be my mindless ramblings from the perspective of a time traveler. Interesting right? I hope all this interest stays till the very end and till then, 
Yours, Forever,
Farhid

title: Getting Bridged with Gar and Kelli
description: Gar and Kelli, lifelong Duluth, Minnesota, residents, chat over the places in Duluth with  stories that need to be told. It's light on history and heavy on nostalgia, and when you're waiting in line for the Arial Lift Bridge to come back down as a Laker is heading through, this might be just what you need.
author_name: Jerry Hallsten and Kelli Hallsten Erickson

title: Good Black News: The Daily Drop
description: A daily drop of Good Black News offers quick, inspiring facts about people, events, culture, history, organizations or landmarks along with quotes, jokes, games and trivia from goodblacknews.org and the Page-A-Day Calendar for 2022 by Lori Lakin Hutcherson and Workman Publishing. Cover Design by Jeronimo Sochaczewski.

title: Pinpoint History
description: Welcome to Pinpoint History! This is a history-based podcast looking to explore and unravel historical moments, examining pivotal moments in time!

title: The Arab-American
description:
In this podcast we dive into a number of topics on the Arab-American way of life. We dig deep into the depths of culture, government, religion and even news to give us a better look at the surroundings of Arab-Americans and how they have managed to place themselves in a society that has essentially displaced them.


Follow me on Instagram @aumro.warrayat and Twitter @aumrowarrayat

title: Storied History
description:
History stories.  Simplified and entertaining. 
 
Probably entertaining. 
 
Possibly entertaining.  

It is definitely probably possible.

title: Sisterstitious. It’s about to get spooky!
description: Two sisters who love a good ghost story. Tune in with us every other Wednesday to hear about some of the world's most haunted places.

title: No Bad Reviews: A Coffee Podcast
description:
Every other week three friends, coworkers, and coffee industry professionals humorously explore topics in history, culture, and business using coffee as inspiration. Then, using their professionally trained palates, they try the coffee and commit to giving no bad reviews.

Hosted by Jenni Trilik, Marcus Contaldo, and Stephanie Motenko.

Sponsored by Modest Coffee
author_name: No Bad Reviews: A Coffee Podcast

title: What the Hekmat?
description: Hekmat Aboukhater is a Syrian American journalist whose studies in International Relations, Economics, and Finance, and lived experience as an immigrant from the Middle East has left him with a plethora of questions about Geopolitics, the American Dream, Globalized Media and many other topics where he's left simply wondering: What the Heck?

title: Subjektiivinen Todistaja
description: Tarinoita ja analyysejä historiasta, salaliitoista, rikoksista sekä yhteiskunnasta. Instagram: subjektiivinentodistaja YouTube: Subjektiivinen Todistaja Gmail: subjektiivinentodistaja@gmail.com

title: Warfare, Advancement, and Revisionism
description: The goal of this project is to document the history of humanity by documenting all of humanity’s attempts to defeat it’s greatest foe. Itself. This is not going to be a straightforward documentation of kings fighting and destroying each other, though there will be many mentions and examples of that. This will attempt to explain our subjects from the ground up. The common foot soldiers to the leaders at their head. Their strategies, tactics, weapons, and technologies. Their triumphs and tragedies. Their lives and their deaths. What they fought for and why. What motivated them. What drove them.

title: The Stuff of Legend: Heinrich Schliemann's Life and Work
description:
Podcast series to accompany the online exhibition The Stuff of Legend: Heinrich Schliemann’s Life and Work. Celebrating the Bicentennial of His Birth. The exhibition commemorates the bicentennial of Schliemann’s birth (1822-2022) drawing inspiration from his vast archive at the American School of Classical Studies at Athens. Correspondence, official documents, his published works, ephemera, and photographs highlight the depth and breadth of Schliemann’s public, professional, and private life. The podcasts have been made to accompany the exhibition by offering a contemporary perspective through interviews with experts in the field of Schliemann studies, or readings from his archive.


Host: Eleftheria Daleziou, Historian and Archivist
Producers: Eleftheria Daleziou, Konstantinos Tzortzinis, and Natalia Vogeikoff-Brogan
author_name: American School of Classical Studies at Athens

title: Unboxing Queer History
description:
Unboxing Queer History is a podcast from Gerber/Hart Library and Archives, one of the largest LGBTQ libraries & archives in the world.

Each of the 8 episodes in Unboxing Queer History focuses on a different story from the LGBTQ history inside of Gerber/Hart’s collections and archives. The episodes range from discussions of the importance of a LGBTQ circulating library to Chicago drag history and include interviews with community leaders, volunteers, researchers, and local historians. 

Unboxing Queer History is created by Ari Mejia, Jen Dentel, and Erin Bell. Produced by Ari Mejia with Hannah Viti. Artwork by Mere Montgomery & theme music by Danny Robles! And special thanks to Jules Gordon for co-producing the episode on People Like Us books and Alyssa Edes for producing the episode on Lorrainne Sade Baskerville!

Special thanks to RAILS (Reaching Across Illinois Library System) for the "My Library Is... " grant that funded this project!

title: Mutual Victory
description:
Welcome to the Mutual Victory Podcast Site
We are Matt and Jeannie O'Neill former teachers who share a love of pop-culture, music, European Board Games, trivia, family and LOVE, and we will cover topics that are current in our lives and fun tidbits on this journey of marriage.


Matt was a Social Studies teacher who now is a Librarian.
Jeannie also used to teach in a more traditional setting and now teaches Yoga and trains people to follow their passion as yoga teachers. They both work (from home, together) at Yoga Farm Ithaca an online teaching platform and nonprofit.
Mutual Victory is their Motto and Mantra, it steers their RelationShip!

title: VálCast
description: Série o všech zajímavých událostech II. světové války, o těch klíčových, o těch méně závažných i o těch, jejichž pozadí je dosud v mlhách. Jestli máte rádi historii, vítáme vás všechny u poslechu našich podcastů

title: Wigs for Whigs History
description: A veteran history/government teacher analyzes topics ranging from the profound to the absurd.

title: Here by the Owl (audiobook)
description: At the height of WWII, the United States plucked nine farm boys from across the country and sent them to a remote island in the Atlantic Ocean for what was designated a "special mission." Here by the Owl is the untold true story of one of those farm boys, a native of the Blue Ridge Mountains named Robert Gray Shipley. While his pregnant wife Agnes is struck with a deadly illness back home, Shipley struggles to understand the horrifying reason why the leaders of the military have made his mission so vital. This full-length audiobook, performed by the author, uses interviews, historic newspaper and magazine articles, long-lost letters, and records from the National Archives to tell a true story of love, loss, and a forgotten Air Force mission that changed the world.

title: Voices of Freedom Podcast
description:
The Voices of Freedom® is a division of the Americans in Wartime Experience, a 501c3 non-profit. Our mission is to record and preserve the stories of Americans, both civilian and military, who serve during wartime. This podcast will showcase those stories that tell of the service and sacrifice of ordinary, everyday Americans whose service and experiences were anything but ordinary.  These stories are told in their own words from their perspective.  Nothing is edited or sugarcoated.  It's a raw and unfiltered look at history from those who eyewitnesses to it.

The Voices of Freedom® is a registered trademark of the Americans in Wartime Experience.

title: No Pollution of Cowardice! -South Jersey in the Civil War
description: Hosted by Dan Casella of the Lawrence Township Historical Society; 'No Pollution of Cowardice!' will tell the stories the brave Men and Woman from the 8 southern counties of New Jersey.  The accounts and experiences of those who lived through and were directly effected by America's most trying period will be told rather then another retelling of historical moments.

title: Dad Lit
description: If it has at least one submarine and one helicopter, it's Dad Lit. Join hosts Chris and Connor as they explore Dad Lit classics by authors such as Tom Clancy, Clive Cussler, and Lee Child, as well as some of the genre's more obscure titles. Book reviews, author deep dives, interviews, and more.

title: Black Sheep
description: Welcome to Black Sheep where we're revealing new discoveries through education, one book at a time.

title: WHISPERS
description:
A short-form history podcast about strange and interesting stories and the secrets and clues that are left behind that...if we listen carefully?

We'll hear those stories' whispers.

title: Karing Conversation
description:
Just a dude with an outspoken view on liberty

"one who thinks they know, does not truly think"

title: SpikeWave
description:
Biblical answers, God, Yahweh, Jehovah, Jesus, Religions/cults, debate, research, objective study, life experience, Christianity.  Taking a look at the beliefs of religions while also including a satirical point of view at times. A podcast that is informative, objective, educational, critical, and that provides a review of religious doctrines, history and teachings.  

spikewavenow@gmail.com

title: The Toad & Beans Podcast
description: The Toad & Beans Podcast discusses a variety of topics from history, to art, to current events.

title: Astonishing
description:
Astonishing is a UK-based podcast which tells incredible and peculiar stories on a bi-weekly schedule. What happened to a famous crime author when she disappeared for 11 days? What terrorised Victorian society on the dark and foggy streets of London? How did the testimony of one little girl change the meaning of the word 'witch' forever? In each episode we will dive into a new story which will have you questioning 'Is life stranger than fiction?'


Produced and presented by Tom Hamilton.

Written by Ben Taylor.

title: Challenging Colonialism
description: Challenging Colonialism amplifies Indigenous perspectives on issues of concern to native Californian communities. It is our intention to create an educational resource where everyone can hear the perspectives of Indigenous peoples in their own words. It is not our intention to further colonize the narrative, or to misrepresent stories that are not our own. The podcast is produced by Martin Rizzo-Martinez, Historian, & Daniel Stonebloom, a Public School Administrator.

title: Manufacturing Dissent
description: Hanz and Shawn cohost the podcast many have called "the best podcast" and "great". Together with members of the crew, they dive into a sleuth of topics ranging from revolutionary theory to hip hop and everything in between, and discuss how their own lived experiences have framed their views on the world.

title: Dying to be Found
description: Meet Deb. A true crime enthusiast who pulls family members into her web of tales whether they want to hear them or not. She's kind of convincing that way! We go across state lines and international borders to not only bring you a variety of family members who double as co-hosts, but we also deliver true crime stories that are left open to interpretation. Dying to be Found has the perfect combination of facts and storytelling that will want you coming back for more! Visit us at www.dyingtobefound.com and on TikTok, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and Pinterest @dying2bfound. Email us at dying2bfound@gmail.com with any storylines you want us to cover. If you like what you hear, please subscribe, leave a review, and tell your friends that we are "Dying to be Found." Find all of our contacts and social media at https://linktr.ee/dying2bfound.

title: Filmoids
description: Your hosts Jonah and Mahoney gather to discuss the cultural, political, aesthetic and historical aspects of only the finest kino. If you wish the irony-poisoned condescension dripping from every prolific Letterboxd reviewer could be piped directly into your ears, you've come to the right place.

title: Nights on the Tree
description: Martin og Niels diskuterer artikler og interviewer personligheder i og omkring vikinge-reenactment miljøet i Danmark

title: Creeps and Crime Storytime - A Paranormal and True Crime Podcast
description: Here to share a mix of paranormal and supernatural mysteries, urban legends and mostly real, true crimes. This podcast will feature information about crime scenes and violence, so listener discretion is advised.

title: Rump Storytales
description: Stories from the rump novel. As told by Rhys, Liam and Jackson

title: Intervenciones Gringas
description: Historia de las intervenciones estadounidenses en Latinoamérica y el mundo. Exploramos las historias detras todos los golpes del estado, guerras, y bombardeos que hizo Estados Unidos para construir su imperio. con Jeremy y Tess!

title: Class... with Teacher Nico
description:
A class for the bold and curious. Attendance is optional. Attention is mandatory.
nicoshow@tutanota.com

title: Observing Fullerton
description: The Official Podcast for the Fullerton Observer Newspaper

title: streetRAPisHistory
description:
Los Angeles history through rap.

LA is full of history and culture. Many of the major streets were named after people who were influential in California settlement and development. In this podcast, we dive into the non-fiction stories of California settlement, presenting each as a rap. Prepare to laugh, learn, and be entertained.

title: Resilient History
description: Resilient History is a podcast that explores forgotten, ignored and partially told history to give curious listeners a more nuanced sense of history than is typically taught in school. The producer is former public radio journalist and now high-school high history teacher Gordon Black. Each episode of Resilient History will feature an expert who'll provide a deeper and more complete examination of the history we think we know.

title: Cabronas Malhabladas
description: Bienvenidos a Cabronas Malhabladas, un podcast donde dos amantes de la historia, y del chisme, hablaran sobre las mujeres más rudas del pasado.

title: Literatura gelatinosa
description:
En este espacio habrá conexiones húmedas en torno a la literatura. ¿Qué tiene que ver Platón con Fey, o la portada de un cereal con Mary Shelley? 

Los tentáculos literarios están ocultos entre nosotros; es cuestión de saber buscar.

title: Plot Twist Podcast: A Grave Affair
description: A podcast about everything that happens the funeral home and beyond- death, decomposition, and the macabre. We’re digging deep into stories you’ve never heard before, visiting unique burial sites, and shining light onto funerary scandals. And there may or may not be a little bit of wine involved...

title: Demystifying Latin and Greek: Undead Languages for Living Brains
description: Dr. Kirsten Jaqua and PhD candidate Anne Phillips, share a passion for teaching Latin and Greek at all levels. This collaborative podcast aims to making learning and teaching ancient languages accessible and fun for all, whether you are a teacher, a parent or a casual learner. In this podcast we explore language-learning approaches and strategies, we review and discuss curricula and resources, and bring in our combined experience to help YOU be the best teacher or learner you can be.

title: Hot Goss History
description: Join friends Ellen and Belle each episode as they ask each other, what's the hot goss? The pair dive into the wild, salacious, and sometime scandalous gossip from history covering the juicy details you likely wont find in your history books!

title: The Rum Shop
description: Your on-the-air watering hole where talk flows freely, debates get spicy and we makin' plenty joke.

title: Havin The Craic
description: Every week comedians Thomas Henry, Jack Hester, Adam Coumas and Dave Anthony sit down to have the craic! Expect hot takes and outright silliness from four of London's top comedians. Join the hang, subscribe today.

title: Micro Machines Podcast
description: Micro Machines is a group of like minded individuals coming together to discuss our favorite subjects, real life armor pieces and modelling and somehow mashing them together into a podcast of history/comedy that can only be described as a "hot mess of stupid jokes, silly memes, a little bit of learning and a whole lot of fun".
